final_action.reasoning: I have a strong draw (open‑ended straight draw needing a 9 and a flush draw with two clubs). The opponent is extremely short‑stacked (4 chips) and has just checked. Raising to the minimum 83 forces them to go all‑in for their remaining 4 chips if they want to continue, giving me good pot odds on my draws while risking only a portion of my stack. Checking would give them a free card, while folding discards a hand with high equity.
